definition:
Let $M$ be a compact smooth manifold and $f\colon M\to M$ a
diffeomorphism. The *homoclinic class* of a hyperbolic periodic point
$p$ of $f$, denoted $H(p,f)$, is the closure of the set of transverse
intersections between the stable and unstable manifolds all points in
the orbit of $p$; i.e.
$$H(p,f)=\operatorname{cl}\left(\bigcup_{n\in {\mathbb{N}}} W^s(p)\pitchfork \bigcup_{n\in {\mathbb{Z}}} W^u(p)\right).$$
Homoclinic classes are topologically transitive, and the number of
homoclinic classes is at most countable. Moreover, generically (in the
$\mathcal{C}^1$ topology of $\operatorname{Diff}(M)$), they are pairwise
disjoint and maximally transitive.
